title: Ticket #3257: Implement USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS mechanism in the negotiator
description:
As a development milestone in support of honoring job priorities across multiple schedds, modify the Negotiator to support the USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS config knob.

See the parent ticket for the design document and further details.
remarks:
2012-Oct-16 11:18:54 by tannenba:

Testing

Setup of test environment

Setup a personal Condor pool, making certain the config is using global job prios, and take the schedd out of the daemon list: 
daemon_list = master, collector, startd, negotiator
use_global_job_prios = true
Next we want the pool to have two schedds, schedd1 and schedd2. To accomplish this, each schedd could have its own copy of the condor_config with customized values for SCHEDD_NAME, LOCAL_DIR, and if testing on Windows we also need to edit PROCD_ADDRESS. So the condor_config.schedd1 would have 
SCHEDD_NAME = schedd1
LOCAL_DIR = c:\wherever\localdirs\schedd1
PROCD_ADDRESS = \\.\pipe\condor_procd_pipe
and the condor_config.schedd2 would have 
SCHEDD_NAME = schedd2
LOCAL_DIR = c:\wherever\localdirs\schedd2
PROCD_ADDRESS = \\.\pipe\condor_procd_pipe2
In the LOCAL_DIR paths specified, create the expected sub-directories like so: 
cd c:\wherever\localdirs\schedd1
mkdir log spool execute
cd c:\wherever\localdirs\schedd1
mkdir log spool execute
Fire up the daemons and confirm the pool sees the two schedds named schedd1 and schedd2 as expected 
C:\home\tannenba>set CONDOR_CONFIG=c:\wherever\condor_config
C:\home\tannenba>condor_master
C:\home\tannenba>set CONDOR_CONFIG=c:\wherever\condor_config.schedd1
C:\home\tannenba>condor_schedd
C:\home\tannenba>set CONDOR_CONFIG=c:\wherever\condor_config.schedd2
C:\home\tannenba>condor_schedd
C:\home\tannenba>condor_status -any

MyType               TargetType           Name

Machine              Job                  ToddsThinkpad
DaemonMaster         None                 ToddsThinkpad
Negotiator           None                 ToddsThinkpad
Scheduler            None                 schedd1@ToddsThinkpad
Scheduler            None                 schedd2@ToddsThinkpad
Collector            None                 tannenba test pool@ToddsThinkp

Basic Test

Turn off the negotiator, since we don't want a negotiation cycle to happen until we have submitted all our jobs to all schedds. Create two job submit files that have job priorities that overlap each other, and submit one to schedd1 and the other to schedd2. Then turn the negotiator back on. 
C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>type test1.sub
executable = c:\utils\date.exe
initialdir = c:\temp
priority = 100
queue 1
priority = 50
queue 3
priority = -5
queue 2

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>type test2.sub
executable = c:\utils\date.exe
initialdir = c:\temp
priority = 90
queue 1
priority = 92
queue 1
priority = 52
queue 3
priority = -5
queue 2

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_off -negotiator
Sent "Kill-Daemon" command for "negotiator" to local master

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_submit -n schedd1@ToddsThinkpad test1.sub
Submitting job(s)
......
6 job(s) submitted to cluster 7.

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_submit -n schedd2@ToddsThinkpad test2.sub
Submitting job(s)
.......
7 job(s) submitted to cluster 3.

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_q -global


-- Schedd: schedd2@ToddsThinkpad : <127.0.0.1:50212>
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
   3.0   tannenba       10/16 10:54   0+00:00:00 I  90  0.0  date.exe
   3.1   tannenba       10/16 10:54   0+00:00:00 I  92  0.0  date.exe
   3.2   tannenba       10/16 10:54   0+00:00:00 I  52  0.0  date.exe
   3.3   tannenba       10/16 10:54   0+00:00:00 I  52  0.0  date.exe
   3.4   tannenba       10/16 10:54   0+00:00:00 I  52  0.0  date.exe
   3.5   tannenba       10/16 10:54   0+00:00:00 I  -5  0.0  date.exe
   3.6   tannenba       10/16 10:54   0+00:00:00 I  -5  0.0  date.exe

7 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 7 idle, 0 running, 0 held, 0 suspended


-- Schedd: schedd1@ToddsThinkpad : <127.0.0.1:50201>
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
   7.0   tannenba       10/16 10:53   0+00:00:00 I  100 0.0  date.exe
   7.1   tannenba       10/16 10:53   0+00:00:00 I  50  0.0  date.exe
   7.2   tannenba       10/16 10:53   0+00:00:00 I  50  0.0  date.exe
   7.3   tannenba       10/16 10:53   0+00:00:00 I  50  0.0  date.exe
   7.4   tannenba       10/16 10:53   0+00:00:00 I  -5  0.0  date.exe
   7.5   tannenba       10/16 10:53   0+00:00:00 I  -5  0.0  date.exe

6 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 6 idle, 0 running, 0 held, 0 suspended

C:\home\tannenba\condor\build_79\test>condor_on -negotiator
Sent "Spawn-Daemon" command for "negotiator" to local master

After one negotiation cycle, confirm that the negotiator contacted the two different schedds in the proper global job prio order and properly limiting the job priority range. Also confirm that the schedd sent only job requests in the requested priority range, sorted in job prio order (compare the output below with the condor_q -global output above). Note the schedd will not send two jobs with the same prio since the negotiator added JobPrio as a significant attribute. 

C:\condor\log>grep -e "Negotiating\|USE_GLOBAL_JOB\|Request" NegotiatorLog | grep -v schedds
10/16/12 10:55:51   Negotiating with tannenba@ToddsThinkpad at <127.0.0.1:50201>
10/16/12 10:55:51     USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS limit to jobprios between 100 and 100
10/16/12 10:55:51     Request 00007.00000:
10/16/12 10:55:51   Negotiating with tannenba@ToddsThinkpad at <127.0.0.1:50212>
10/16/12 10:55:51     USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS limit to jobprios between 52 and 92
10/16/12 10:55:51     Request 00003.00001:
10/16/12 10:55:51     Request 00003.00000:
10/16/12 10:55:51     Request 00003.00002:
10/16/12 10:55:51   Negotiating with tannenba@ToddsThinkpad at <127.0.0.1:50201>
10/16/12 10:55:51     USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS limit to jobprios between -5 and 50
10/16/12 10:55:51     Request 00007.00001:
10/16/12 10:55:51     Request 00007.00004:
10/16/12 10:55:51   Negotiating with tannenba@ToddsThinkpad at <127.0.0.1:50212>
10/16/12 10:55:51     USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS limit to jobprios between -5 and -5
10/16/12 10:55:51     Request 00003.00005:

2012-Oct-17 15:50:26 by tstclair:
Quick 1st blush in looking through this:

1. Use of MyString was to be deprecated. 2. We totally need tests for this, I don't see any, yet it's in the review state. ... I'll still dig.

2012-Oct-17 17:24:28 by tannenba:
Looking at my test results above, and given that the schedd will reuse a claim from a different autocluster, I have come to the conclusion that it is stupid for the Negotiator to add jobprio to the list of significant attributes (as specified in the design doc). All this does is waste time during the negotiation cycle. In the above test, the schedd sends job 3.1, 3.0, 3.2... if jobprio was not significant, it could have just sent 3.1 and been done.

Longer term, maybe we want the match record in the schedd to have a constraint, e.g. 

    owner==X && jobprio >= Y and jobprio <= Z

but that is beyond the scope here.

EDIT: went ahead and pushed [33694] to fix this

2012-Dec-11 16:39:58 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070902 to v070903 using ./ticket-target-mover.
check_ins:
2012-Oct-19 11:43   Check-in [33707]: Change consolidate_globaljobprio_submitter_ads to have fewer assumptions about its inputs, #3257 Part of the USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS code. compiler warnings led us to take another look at this function, and it made many assumptions about the order of submitter ads in its input stream. these assumptions [...] (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2012-Oct-17 17:48   Check-in [33694]: Do not automatically add JobPrio to significant attributes with global jobprios. #3257 #3218 Upon more reflection, adding JobPrio to the significant attributes here just increases negotiation time, even with USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS. (By Todd Tannenbaum )
2012-Oct-15 13:05   Check-in [33672]: Fix compiler warnings re unused variable. #3257 #3218 (By Todd Tannenbaum )
2012-Oct-15 12:51   Check-in [33671]: Implement USE_GLOBAL_JOB_PRIOS mechanism in the negotiator. #3257 Negotiation protocol extended so negotiator can request only jobs from user X with job priorities between Y and Z based on job priority array attribute visible in the submitter ad; wire compatibility is ensured by just adding new attributes [...] (By Todd Tannenbaum )
